properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 6 at 11:00PM EST until February 7 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches
and ice accumulations of a light glaze.

* WHERE...McKean, Warren, Potter and Tioga Counties.

* WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will likely impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to freezing rain and sleet
after midnight and then to heavy snow in the pre dawn hours.
Snowfall rates as high as one inch per hour are possible around
and shortly after sunrise. Northwest winds will gust between 20
and 30 mph Friday afternoon while temperatures fall through the
20s.
properties.instruction:
The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways.

Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway
and traffic conditions.

To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook
page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST FRIDAY
